title: Isolate the Radical Exponent Terms
text: Isolate the radical exponent terms on one side of the equation. We can add 3 on both sides get $${\left(6x+1\right)}^{\frac{1}{2}}=7$$ which has radical terms isolated on one side.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To Second Power
text: $${\left(6x+1\right)}^{\frac{1}{2}}=7^2$$ After squaring both sides, we get $$6x+1=49$$.

title: Check For Remaining Radicals Exponent Terms
text: Are there any more radicals? No. We can proceed to the next step.

title: Solve For Equation
text: What is the value of x for $$6x+1=49$$?
